title: Compiler suggests type conversion on LHS of assignment

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-suggestion-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: suggestions generated by the compiler applied by cargo fix

body:
```rust
fn main() {
    let mut foo: u16 = 0;
    
    foo = Some(0u32).unwrap();
}
```

([Playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=2c8725c87e4820a453fb93a92037299f))

Errors:

```
   Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
error[E0308]: mismatched types
 --> src/main.rs:4:11
  |
4 |     foo = Some(0u32).unwrap();
  |           ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ expected `u16`, found `u32`
  |
help: you can convert `foo` from `u16` to `u32`, matching the type of `Some(0u32).unwrap()`
  |
4 |     u32::from(foo) = Some(0u32).unwrap();
  |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

error: aborting due to previous error

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0308`.
error: could not compile `playground`

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.

```

Thank you for Rust! It's a great language! :heart:
